title: A Minor Gripe about Fiora's Passive...
body:
I'm not gonna comment on Fiora's viability, and whether or not she's underpowered or overpowered. She's far better than her old kit, that's for sure. But one gripe I have about her kit without regards to balance is her passive. More specifically, that the side on which the Vitals appear is completely random. This can make it unreliable and difficult to play around, for both Fiora and her opponent, especially in the thick of battle. Popped an enemy's Vital? Now try and keep track and see where the next one shows up while also trying to survive a teamfight and keep track of eight other bodies. Even in laning the unpredictability of her passive can be costly. It requires Fiora waste valuable seconds in a game where split-second reactions are key trying to track where the next Vital shows up, and her threat level rises and drops unpredictably based on where the Vital is. Even for the opponent this is troublesome, because they have to wait and hope the next Vital shows up in a spot they can easily protect.

Riot has repeatedly said they don't like luck or RNG in their game (barring crit), and Fiora's passive currently has it aplenty. So my suggestion is pretty simple; give the Vitals a predetermined pattern, or maybe even pattern**s**, that Fiora players and her opponents can learn and play around. This would give Fiora much more clear highs and lows that can be reacted to much more quickly for both sides.

Yes? No? Maybe? Feedback appreciated.

replies.body:
I do not think the manifestation of vitals are _completely_ random; if a vital appears on one side, it is guaranteed it will show up on a side opposite that.

I am not saying Fiora's passive should be left as it is, believe me I am all for more reliability, but I do not think the placement is random.
This is correct, it alternates red side (2 options) -> blue side (2 options) so it's pseudo random you might say.

Why does it seem (and I could be wrong on this) that I can "miss" procing her passive by being TOO close to the enemy? There are times it is up there and I Q dash into hit that side but I end on the correct side of the champion, but I don't proc the passive until I take a step back.
Not sure, this isn't intended behavior. Will look into it to see if there are any rare case bugs etc.

I had in no way moved enough to trigger everything though.  I had only covered what should have been half the ult, but all the marks vanished, and I got the heal.  And considering the target was still alive, I sure didn't kill them for the ult proc...

I've actually melted people as Fiora because Vitals kept showing up on the same side and I didn't have to move. It's pretty random.

I've been playing a lot of Fiora lately. It's actually not too hard to keep on vitals with the right items and/or Ghost/Flash. At max CDR you can dash every 1.9ish seconds and her E helps too. As well Phage and its Rage passive speeds you up a fair bit. Combine all this with Ghost and you're set. 

In lane you can actually back up until your opponent is out of range to reset the passive and potentially put the vital in a better position, something my opponent is also capable of (though most don't realise it). I do this a lot to harass my opponents to the point of staying away from their own minions.

What I personally don't like about the vitals is the hitbox on them is so fickle. Often I think I'm going to hit the vital but it doesn't pop. Tends to happen a lot if I'm right on top of them.

The ult is also delayed and clunky. You can ult a person, Q right after, and still manage to miss a vital. One time, I was standing right on top of a person I ult'd and managed to never hit a vital even after 3 or 4 AA's. Also, apparently if you're hitting a person diagonally you can also miss vitals.
I've noticed that a lot too, both hitting nothing when on top of them and missing vitals diagonally. It's really annoying

And on my own note: Fiora vs Fiora matches are awful. It genuinely feels like RNG the game.

I personally like Fiora v. Fiora. So many people I play against don't seem to know that you can reset her passive for better vitals. That's the key to beating out a another Fiora in lane, and the mechanic in general is what I think really sets good and okay Fioras apart.

I feel like new Fiora in general can be pretty frustrating to play against just judging from how other people act in lane when I'm playing her (she's all I've been playing lately so I can't really speak from a victim standpoint). Last night I had a Hecarim staying so far away he was out of vision range because they didn't want their vitals poked. They lost a lot of gold and xp because I wasn't pushing lane. Others I've went against ended up feeding me kills because they wanted to farm which let me poke them down enough with my passive to finish them off with an ult, and when Fiora has you ulted and is Ghosting you aren't getting away.
The Riposte is also quite handy for the "counterplay" champions. I can't imagine what it was like for the Dariuses and such I've played against.

I just don't like when I ult someone and can repeatedly auto attack someone and not proc a single passive because the hitboxes are so unforgiving. I feel like I can hit the gaps between the 4 Vitals instead of the actual Vitals themselves on a consistent basis. Can we at least make all the Vitals touch so you can at least guarantee 1 hit during your ult?

Yeah, it's pretty hard to track in teamfights, but if you want a little help during laning move back a bit and you can reset the vital points. This is useful if you are playing as or against Fiora. I think they will her as is so she can have a defined weakness (teamfights) and a defined strength (duels).
Another issue actually, is that there's no indication of the range of her passive. Some range indicator as to how far or how close you have to be to make Vitals appeal.
I don't see this as too much of a problem, but it would be nice to see it when you hover over the passive icon.
Something as simple as that is exactly what I'd like to see. Just an idea to know where you gotta be to make vitals appear.

Patterns sounds like a good idea, but we don't want the Fiora or the enemy game play to become to predictable or repetitive.

If there's gonna be a pattern then it should a multitude of patterns that can be chosen. Which pattern the game picks of course would be random, but if Fiora or the enemy can recognize the pattern - the sequence of the vital spot location then thats cool; it opens a lot of doors. 

Also the sequence should be relatively long and after completing the pattern a few times it should switch to another pattern.

Hows that?
